trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights SDK to monitor your ASP.NET app

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.

trans-unit.source: INCLURE <link><linkText>app-insights-selector-get-started</linkText><title></title></link>]
trans-unit.target: INCLURE <link><linkText>app-insights-selector-get-started</linkText><title></title></link>]

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Application Insights monitors your live application to help you <link><linkText>detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions[detect]</linkText><title></title></link>, et <link><linkText>discover how your app is used[knowusers]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Application Insights monitors your live application to help you <link><linkText>detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions[detect]</linkText><title></title></link>, et <link><linkText>discover how your app is used[knowusers]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It can be used with a wide variety of application types.
trans-unit.target: It can be used with a wide variety of application types.

trans-unit.source: It works for apps that are hosted on your own on-premises IIS servers or on Azure VMs, as well as Azure web apps.
trans-unit.target: It works for apps that are hosted on your own on-premises IIS servers or on Azure VMs, as well as Azure web apps.

trans-unit.source: (<link><linkText>Device apps and Java servers are also covered[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.)
trans-unit.target: (<link><linkText>Device apps and Java servers are also covered[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Example performance monitoring charts</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Example performance monitoring charts</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For many application types, <link><linkText>Visual Studio can add Application Insights to your app</linkText><title></title></link> almost without you noticing.
trans-unit.target: For many application types, <link><linkText>Visual Studio can add Application Insights to your app</linkText><title></title></link> almost without you noticing.

trans-unit.source: But since you're reading this to get a better understanding of what's going on, we'll take you through the steps manually.
trans-unit.target: But since you're reading this to get a better understanding of what's going on, we'll take you through the steps manually.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: You need:
trans-unit.target: You need:

trans-unit.source: A subscription to <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A subscription to <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your <link><linkText>Microsoft account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your <link><linkText>Microsoft account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 or later.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 or later.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> 1. Create an Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> 1. Create an Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>, and create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>, and create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Choose ASP.NET as the application type.
trans-unit.target: Choose ASP.NET as the application type.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click New, Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click New, Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A <link><linkText>resource[roles]</linkText><title></title></link> in Azure is an instance of a service.
trans-unit.target: A <link><linkText>resource[roles]</linkText><title></title></link> in Azure is an instance of a service.

trans-unit.source: This resource is where telemetry from your app will be analyzed and presented to you.
trans-unit.target: This resource is where telemetry from your app will be analyzed and presented to you.

trans-unit.source: The choice of application type sets the default content of the resource blades and the properties visible in <link><linkText>Metrics Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The choice of application type sets the default content of the resource blades and the properties visible in <link><linkText>Metrics Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Take a copy of the Instrumentation Key.
trans-unit.target: Take a copy of the Instrumentation Key.

trans-unit.source: The key identifies the resource, and you'll install it soon in the SDK to direct data to the resource.
trans-unit.target: The key identifies the resource, and you'll install it soon in the SDK to direct data to the resource.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> 2. Install the SDK in your application
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> 2. Install the SDK in your application

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, edit the NuGet packages of your desktop app project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, edit the NuGet packages of your desktop app project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Right-click the project and select Manage Nuget Packages</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Right-click the project and select Manage Nuget Packages</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Install Application Insights SDK for Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Install Application Insights SDK for Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Search for "Application Insights"</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Search for "Application Insights"</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Edit ApplicationInsights.config (which has been added by the NuGet install).
trans-unit.target: Edit ApplicationInsights.config (which has been added by the NuGet install).

trans-unit.source: Insert this just before the closing tag:
trans-unit.target: Insert this just before the closing tag:

trans-unit.source: the instrumentation key you copied
trans-unit.target: the instrumentation key you copied

trans-unit.source: (You can alternatively <link><linkText>set the key by writing some code[apikey]</linkText><title></title></link> in your app.)
trans-unit.target: (You can alternatively <link><linkText>set the key by writing some code[apikey]</linkText><title></title></link> in your app.)

trans-unit.source: To upgrade to future SDK versions
trans-unit.target: To upgrade to future SDK versions

trans-unit.source: To upgrade to a <link><linkText>new release of the SDK</linkText><title></title></link>, open NuGet package manager again and filter on installed packages.
trans-unit.target: To upgrade to a <link><linkText>new release of the SDK</linkText><title></title></link>, open NuGet package manager again and filter on installed packages.

trans-unit.source: Select Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web and choose Upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Select Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web and choose Upgrade.

trans-unit.source: If you made any customizations to ApplicationInsights.config, save a copy of it before you upgrade, and afterwards merge your changes into the new version.
trans-unit.target: If you made any customizations to ApplicationInsights.config, save a copy of it before you upgrade, and afterwards merge your changes into the new version.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> 3. Run your project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> 3. Run your project

trans-unit.source: Run your application with F5 and try it out: open different pages to generate some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Run your application with F5 and try it out: open different pages to generate some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> 4. View your telemetry
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> 4. View your telemetry

trans-unit.source: Return to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link> and Browse to your Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Return to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link> and Browse to your Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Look for data in the Overview charts.
trans-unit.target: Look for data in the Overview charts.

trans-unit.source: At first, you'll just see one or two points.
trans-unit.target: At first, you'll just see one or two points.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click through to more data</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click through to more data</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learn more about metrics.[perf]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learn more about metrics.[perf]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Now deploy your application and watch the data accumulate.
trans-unit.target: Now deploy your application and watch the data accumulate.

trans-unit.source: When you run in debug mode, telemetry is expedited through the pipeline, so that you should see data appearing within seconds.
trans-unit.target: When you run in debug mode, telemetry is expedited through the pipeline, so that you should see data appearing within seconds.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy your app, data accumulates more slowly.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy your app, data accumulates more slowly.

trans-unit.source: No data?
trans-unit.target: No data?

trans-unit.source: Open the <link><linkText>Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title></link> tile, to see individual events.
trans-unit.target: Open the <link><linkText>Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title></link> tile, to see individual events.

trans-unit.source: Use the application, opening different pages so that it generates some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Use the application, opening different pages so that it generates some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Wait a few seconds and click Refresh.
trans-unit.target: Wait a few seconds and click Refresh.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Trouble on your build server?
trans-unit.target: Trouble on your build server?

trans-unit.source: Please see <link><linkText>this Troubleshooting item</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Please see <link><linkText>this Troubleshooting item</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Add dependency tracking
trans-unit.target: Add dependency tracking

trans-unit.source: The SDK needs a little help to get access to some data.
trans-unit.target: The SDK needs a little help to get access to some data.

trans-unit.source: In particular, you'll need this additional step in order to automatically measure calls from your app to databases, REST APIs, and other external components.
trans-unit.target: In particular, you'll need this additional step in order to automatically measure calls from your app to databases, REST APIs, and other external components.

trans-unit.source: These dependency metrics can be invaluable to help you diagnose performance issues.
trans-unit.target: These dependency metrics can be invaluable to help you diagnose performance issues.

trans-unit.source: If your app runs in your IIS server
trans-unit.target: If your app runs in your IIS server

trans-unit.source: Login to your server with admin rights, and install <link><linkText>Application Insights Status Monitor</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Login to your server with admin rights, and install <link><linkText>Application Insights Status Monitor</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: (You can also use Status Monitor to <link><linkText>instrument an app that's already running</linkText><title></title></link>, even if it hasn't been built with the SDK.)
trans-unit.target: (You can also use Status Monitor to <link><linkText>instrument an app that's already running</linkText><title></title></link>, even if it hasn't been built with the SDK.)

trans-unit.source: If your app is an Azure Web App
trans-unit.target: If your app is an Azure Web App

trans-unit.source: In the control panel of your Azure Web App, add the Application Insights extension.
trans-unit.target: In the control panel of your Azure Web App, add the Application Insights extension.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In your web app, Settings, Extensions, Add, Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In your web app, Settings, Extensions, Add, Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: (The extension only assists an app that has been built with the SDK.
trans-unit.target: (The extension only assists an app that has been built with the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Unlike Status Monitor, it can't instrument an existing app.)
trans-unit.target: Unlike Status Monitor, it can't instrument an existing app.)

trans-unit.source: Add client-side monitoring
trans-unit.target: Add client-side monitoring

trans-unit.source: You've installed the SDK that sends telemetry data from the server end of your application.
trans-unit.target: You've installed the SDK that sends telemetry data from the server end of your application.

trans-unit.source: Now you can add client-side monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Now you can add client-side monitoring.

trans-unit.source: This provides you with data on users, sessions, page views, and any exceptions or crashes that occur in the client.
trans-unit.target: This provides you with data on users, sessions, page views, and any exceptions or crashes that occur in the client.

trans-unit.source: You'll also be able to write your own code to track how your users work with your app, right down to the detailed level of clicks and keystrokes.
trans-unit.target: You'll also be able to write your own code to track how your users work with your app, right down to the detailed level of clicks and keystrokes.

trans-unit.source: If your clients are web browsers
trans-unit.target: If your clients are web browsers

trans-unit.source: If your app displays web pages, add a JavaScript snippet to every page.
trans-unit.target: If your app displays web pages, add a JavaScript snippet to every page.

trans-unit.source: Get the code from your Application Insights resource:
trans-unit.target: Get the code from your Application Insights resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In your web app, open Quick Start and click 'Get code to monitor my web pages'</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In your web app, open Quick Start and click 'Get code to monitor my web pages'</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Notice that the code contains the instrumentation key that identifies your application resource.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the code contains the instrumentation key that identifies your application resource.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learn more about web page tracking.</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learn more about web page tracking.</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: If your clients are device apps
trans-unit.target: If your clients are device apps

trans-unit.source: If your application is serving clients such as phones or other devices, add the <link><linkText>appropriate SDK</linkText><title></title></link> to your device app.
trans-unit.target: If your application is serving clients such as phones or other devices, add the <link><linkText>appropriate SDK</linkText><title></title></link> to your device app.

trans-unit.source: If you configure the client SDK with the same instrumentation key as the server SDK, the two streams will be integrated so that you can see them together.
trans-unit.target: If you configure the client SDK with the same instrumentation key as the server SDK, the two streams will be integrated so that you can see them together.

trans-unit.source: Complete your installation
trans-unit.target: Complete your installation

trans-unit.source: To get the full 360-degree view of your application, there are a few more things you can do:
trans-unit.target: To get the full 360-degree view of your application, there are a few more things you can do:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Set up web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title></link> to make sure your application stays live and responsive.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Set up web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title></link> to make sure your application stays live and responsive.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Capture log traces[netlogs]</linkText><title></title></link> from your favorite logging framework
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Capture log traces[netlogs]</linkText><title></title></link> from your favorite logging framework

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Track custom events and metrics[api]</linkText><title></title></link> in client or server or both, to learn more about how your application is used.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Track custom events and metrics[api]</linkText><title></title></link> in client or server or both, to learn more about how your application is used.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> The automated way
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> The automated way

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to use Visual Studio to set things up, it's very simple.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to use Visual Studio to set things up, it's very simple.

trans-unit.source: You'll need <link><linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Update 3</linkText><title></title></link> or later and an account in <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You'll need <link><linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Update 3</linkText><title></title></link> or later and an account in <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If it's a new project...
trans-unit.target: If it's a new project...

trans-unit.source: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, make sure Application Insights is selected.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, make sure Application Insights is selected.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an ASP.NET project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an ASP.NET project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the .config file.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the .config file.

trans-unit.source: If your project has web pages, it also adds the <link><linkText>JavaScript SDK[client]</linkText><title></title></link> to the master web page.
trans-unit.target: If your project has web pages, it also adds the <link><linkText>JavaScript SDK[client]</linkText><title></title></link> to the master web page.

trans-unit.source: ... or if it's an existing project
trans-unit.target: ... or if it's an existing project

trans-unit.source: Right click the project in Solution Explorer, and choose Add Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Right click the project in Solution Explorer, and choose Add Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Add Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Add Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the .config file.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio creates a resource in Application Insights, adds the SDK to your project, and places the key in the .config file.

trans-unit.source: In this case, it doesn't add the <link><linkText>JavaScript SDK[client]</linkText><title></title></link> to your web pages - we recommend you do that as the next step.
trans-unit.target: In this case, it doesn't add the <link><linkText>JavaScript SDK[client]</linkText><title></title></link> to your web pages - we recommend you do that as the next step.

trans-unit.source: Setup options
trans-unit.target: Setup options

trans-unit.source: If this is your first time, you'll be asked login or sign up to Microsoft Azure Preview.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first time, you'll be asked login or sign up to Microsoft Azure Preview.

trans-unit.source: (It's separate from your Visual Studio Online account.)
trans-unit.target: (It's separate from your Visual Studio Online account.)

trans-unit.source: If this app is part of a bigger application, you might want to use Configure settings to put it in the same resource group as the other components.
trans-unit.target: If this app is part of a bigger application, you might want to use Configure settings to put it in the same resource group as the other components.

trans-unit.source: *No Application Insights option?
trans-unit.target: *No Application Insights option?

trans-unit.source: Check you're using Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 or later, that Application Insights Tools are enabled in Extensions and Updates, and that you're creating a web project.*
trans-unit.target: Check you're using Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 or later, that Application Insights Tools are enabled in Extensions and Updates, and that you're creating a web project.*

trans-unit.source: Open Application Insights from your project.
trans-unit.target: Open Application Insights from your project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Right-click your project and open the Azure portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Right-click your project and open the Azure portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Video
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Video
